allReviews.body: So I was really pretty skeptical at first of buying a refurbished iPhone off of Amazon no less, but I was in desperate need of a new phone and Amazon partners with Affirm so I could finance, so I carefully read through the reviews and ultimately ordered the dark green iPhone 13 back in April and here I am in almost September and I can’t even tell you how happy and impressed I am with this phone!! So glad I went this route and bought a refurbished iPhone through Amazon and didn’t spend hundreds more at a phone store! If you’re on the fence, I definitely recommend!!I feel I should also mention real quick that only about a WEEK after I got the phone I dropped it the freaking TOILET and at first I was HORRIFIED, I of course majorly panicked and acted very quickly so it was only in water for a few seconds and I dried it off as thoroughly as physically possible (don’t use rice!) but I of course am so relieved to say that even after that incident the phone is still in perfect operating condition!

allReviews.title:
5.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    Awesome iPhone
allReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on March 2, 2023
allReviews.body: This is my second iPhone my first was an iPhone 12 Pro Max. I have to say that for me the pro max isn't worth the extra money and the size is too big to use with just one hand but this iPhone 13 with it's 6.1 inch screen is just perfect for that. The battery life is really good I can go two or maybe even three days of use before having to recharge the phone. The display is awesome but all OLED displays are awesome and I love that this phone can display Dolby Vision so I can watch Netflix in 4k on my phone if I wanted to. I can't speak to the speakers because I always use my Bose Bluetooth headphones or the Bluetooth in my car. The pictures are amazing and coming from a crappy Samsung A10E to this the pictures really amazed me with how easy it is to use the camera and how even with my shaky hands they come out very clearly almost as if I was using a tripod and the zoom function is crazy good with how much detail is available even when using the zoom. I'm glad I waited for the iPhone 14 to come out because I got to save myself $100 but even then it's still a crazy expensive purchase coming to a total price of $804 (if I remember correctly) for the 128GB version so brace yourself for that. Even though it was more money I'm glad I bought it brand new as opposed to used off Amazon like I did with my iPhone 12 Pro Max. It's just better because you don't have to worry about what condition it will be in or how much battery life it will still have left on it. Even using Amazon's Premium Renewed plan with a one year return window and a supposed guarantee of a battery life of at least 90% which the first phone didn't have so I had to return it and wait for my refund which takes literally one month to do. I'm not sure why but I've had to return two phones to Amazon and both times it took exactly 30 days before my money was refunded to me and I was able to buy another phone. Trust me just avoid it because going one month without a phone is no easy thing to do (unless you have an extra $800 lying around and can buy another one right away). All in all I'd definitely recommend this phone to my friends or anyone else for that matter. While it may not have the level of customization that an Android phone may have it has better app support and it's greatly easier to use even for the first time. Plus Apple's maps app just blows Google maps out of the water with their directions. It even tells you if there is a stop sign coming up or if there is a speed trap ahead which is something that Google or Samsung never could do. Just buy it you won't regret it even at a price of over $800.

    Read the description carefully
criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on July 21, 2024
criticalReviews.body: We purchased a iPhone 13 premium renewed phone. According to the information, a technician should’ve tested it before shipping. When it arrived, cosmetically it was perfect. Charged it, phone booted up, but there was a passcode needed. Phones that are factory reset and looked over by a technician shouldn’t have a passcode. I chatted with Amazon and they started a return right away. Once they received the phone, Amazon waits 30 days from receipt to refund your for money because it was a large purchase. We had to chat again after the 30 days as the refund did not process and the customer service person had to “manually” process the refund. The refund was received in full on day 31. It was a hassle, but I think this is not the norm and we just were unlucky. I think Amazon could’ve done a better job of processing the return since it was their fault and not our fault, which is why I’m giving the 1 rating.We ordered a second iPhone premium renewed and it came in perfect. Set up was easy and quick. Transferred data from my old phone and it was up and working in less than 10 minutes. It’s a shame we didn’t have this experience with the first phone we ordered. We have purchased 2 other iPhones from Amazon for other family members and have been pleased.The phone itself works as expected. Flawless cosmetically. 95% battery life.Would I purchase again. Yes. Do I love how the transaction was handled. No.

criticalReviews.title:
1.0 out of 5 stars







  
  
    WORST CUSTOMER SERVICE
criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on April 1, 2023
criticalReviews.body: I AM BEYOND DISSATISFIED AND DISAPPOINTED.I bought an iPhone as my husband’s birthday gift. He opened it and put his SIM card in and started transferring his information. As soon as everything was transferred, he got a text message (see picture) stating that the phone was attached to an account with an unpaid balance. We immediately contacted Amazon and the representative stated that the best option was to contact AT&T who could reset the phone. We called AT&T and we’re told that the phone is a BLACKLISTED aka STOLEN phone!! We immediately called Amazon back and explained the situation and was told by that representative that he was “sorry to hear that, but maybe I should’ve bought something more special” for my husband’s gift. I was told there is nothing he could do but send me the return label. I tried to ask what does Amazon do to “renew” their phones and ensure this does not happen again and he said that he is just customer service and that’s not something he handles. I then called the support number on the “Certified Renewed” card included in the phone’s packaging. I was first sent to Kindle support and he transferred me to the correct department. The next representative told me that the only thing she could do was send me a return label. I posed the question again how Amazon certifies their devices to ensure we do not get another black listed phone again. She stated “we don’t have an answer for that question” and “maybe I just got unlucky because this usually does not happen”. In conclusion, this was the worst customer service I have experienced in years and I am truly disappointed and disgusted with how this situation was handled.

criticalReviews.date: Reviewed in the United States on January 4, 2024
criticalReviews.body: Edit: This same thing happened with the replacement phone. If you are in a pinch I would just spend the extra money and buy brand new. What a hassle.Did you know the carrier isn't the only thing that can stop your refurb phone from being set up with your carrier. A previous carrier may have also locked the IEMI for a number of reasons rendering the phone totally unusable with ANY carrier. You would think for the premium refurb this would be checked? No worries though, only took me 6 live chats and four hours for someone to figure this out and advise me, and then miss work because I can't access VPN security without my phone number. Thanks for sending a dud nerds, feel like you all owe me now, was counting on that working and paid a premium to get it in time. sadge.

After powering the device down and turning it on again, I finally called my mobile provider and learned that the phone's IMEI was locked. Most likely its previous owner was a victim of theft and had reported the device as stolen. Thankfully, the return request was approved, but it will take up to 30 days for the charge to be refunded to my credit card per Amazon's policy. Buyer beware!
